keyword: how much calories in rice and chicken
title: How Many Calories in Rice and Chicken?
meta_description: Discover how much calories in rice and chicken for a standard serving, including protein, carbs, fat breakdown, and easy tweaks to customize your meal.
h1: How Many Calories in Rice and Chicken?
assumptions: 1 cup cooked white rice (158 g) + 100 g grilled skinless chicken breast; no added oils, sauces, or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by rice type, chicken cut, cooking method, portion sizes, and added ingredients. Check labels or recipes for precision.

quick_answer.text: A standard serving of rice and chicken provides ~370 kcal, with high protein from the chicken.

label_note: Values align with Nutrition Facts labels for straightforward meal tracking.

tweaks.label: Use brown rice instead of white

faqs.q: How much calories in rice and chicken per serving?
faqs.a: About 370 kcal for 1 cup white rice and 100 g grilled chicken breast.

faqs.q: What's the protein in rice and chicken?
faqs.a: Roughly 35 g, mostly from the chicken portion.

faqs.q: Does rice and chicken have a lot of carbs?
faqs.a: Yes, around 45 g from the rice; choose brown rice for more fiber.

faqs.q: How to lower calories in rice and chicken?
faqs.a: Use less rice, skinless chicken, and skip oils or sauces to reduce by 50+ kcal.
Yes, about 4 g fat per serving if grilled without added oils.
